Key Match Events: Cincinnati cruised to an easy 11-1 win over the Twins in the most recent game of this series.
Nick Martinez pitched well for the Reds, going six innings and giving up just one run with six strikeouts and no walks.
Simeon Woods Richardson had a rough outing for the Twins, giving up three earned runs in just three innings of work.
TJ Friedl and Jake Fraley each homered for the Reds.
Jonathan India scored twice and drove in two runs while going 2/4.
Noelvi Marte also had a two-hit game at the plate.
Pre-Game Insights: David Festa will be starting for the Twins, while the Reds are sending Rhett Lowder to the mound.
The money line odds have the Twins at -160, while the Reds are the slight underdog at +136.
The over/under line is sitting at 8.5 runs.
The forecast calls for broken clouds and temperatures in the upper 60s.
Cincinnati is 73-77 this season, and they have won two straight, putting them 4th in the NL Central.
The Twins are 3rd in the AL Central, but they have lost two in a row.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Today's over/under line for the Cincinnati Reds' road game against the Minnesota Twins is set at 8.5 runs.
Rhett Lowder will be making his third start of the season for the Reds, and this time it will be on the road against the Twins.
Elly De La Cruz has been a bright spot for the Reds this season, as his 24 home runs are the most on the team.
Spencer Steer is the team's top run producer, as his 88 RBIs are 15th in the league.
Jeimer Candelario is also near the top of the Reds' home run leaderboard, with 20 long balls.
Over his last eight games, TJ Friedl is hitting .370 with two homers and has driven in seven runs.
With an overall record of 78-70, the Twins are 6.5 games behind the Guardians for the AL Central lead.
Minnesota has been good at home this year, putting together a record of 41-33.
Right-hander David Festa gets the start for the Twins today as he faces off against the Reds at home.
Carlos Santana has been swinging a hot bat for the Twins, going 5/14 in his last four games with a home run and three RBIs.
As a team, the Twins are averaging 4.7 runs per game, which is 11th in the league.
